sentence.Network_en: It is the world's largest tidal mangrove forest.
sentence.Network_cn: 它是世界上最大的红树林沼泽地。

sentence.Network_en: The area also contains forests of palm, cypress, mangrove and pine.
sentence.Network_cn: 大沼泽的林区里有棕榈树, 丝柏, 红树林和松树.

sentence.Network_en: It contains the world's largest area of mangrove forests.
sentence.Network_cn: 这里有世界上最大的红树林地区.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 红树林（Mangrove）,是一种热带、南亚热带特有的海岸带植物群落，因主要由红树科的植物组成而得名。组成的物种包括草本、藤本 …

list.abs: 图文2009年7月27日 - 蝙蝠洞(Gua kelawar)该洞在靠近吉林河(Kilim River)的主岛上红树林沼泽(Mangrove swamp)深处,因此只能乘船穿过红树林前往。.

红树林伴生植物（Mangrove associates）：伴随红树林生长的草本、蔓藤及灌木。如黄槿、木麻黄等。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: probably from Portuguese mangue, Spanish mangle, from Taino. The change in the ending was due to association with grove

entry.tran: 红树(生长于热带国家的沿海或江河之畔，其须根高于地面)
entry.def: A mangrove or mangrove tree is a tree with roots which are above the ground and that grows along coasts or on the banks of large rivers in hot countries.

means.word_mean: 1. a tropical tree or shrub bearing fruit that germinates while still on the tree and having numerous prop roots that eventually form an impenetrable mass and are important in land building
